Thanks for following along on this #GenZ trends thread! Would love to hear what I'm missing! 7/7

Trend #5: Social gaming
Approximately 90% of #GenZ classifies themselves as gamers. These platforms are becoming a new social network that allow for creation and building! 6/

Trend #4: For creators
#GenZ values platforms and tools that serve independent content creators and community builders. These includes the rise of app-building tools that are low-code/no code. 5/

Trend #3: Customization
#GenZ has an expectation that products and experiences can be tailored towards them. Examples of impact are in retail/beauty (with augmented reality and AI), as well as healthcare (more holistic + taking advantage of wearables in individualized care). 4/

Trend #2: Environmentalism and sustainability
This can be seen in the rise of second-hand apparel over fast fashion and eating less meat. Look for an expectation that ESG practices become the norm. #GenZ 3/

Trend #1: Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI)
#GenZ is the first majority-minority and most socially-conscious generation. They like when brands to take a stand on social issues and are value-driven. They're also globally-minded. 2/

Tonight I had the opportunity to present to the @MichiganRoss' Zell Lurie Commercialization Fund some #GenZ trends to watch for investment and entrepreneurship. (Gen Z are about ages 8-23 and the first true "digital native" generation!) 1/
